page.title: 13ECOLOGY: THE RIVER MEDINA
page.content: Almost dividing our area in half, the {RIVER MEDINA}flows northwards towards Newport. At first glance we were disappointed; instead of the exciting river we hoped to play in, we found that at this early stage the RIVER MEDINA was only 0.75m-1m wide. We had fun jumping across it, trying not to fall in the muddy parts alongside the river. Farmers do not seem to be so adventurous about jumping, and have built small wooden bridges at intervals! One bridge we discovered is 2-3m wide and 4-5m long. Several drains from the farmland join the river. Cridmore farm has enlarged a pond to attract wild fowl in their marshy area. The Wilderness is mostly marsh and rough pasture; it covers about 24 hectares. Cridmore means rough moor.
